title: Quick Slab/Sans question
content:
I need a slab serif for a project and think I will go with [Stag](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203163322/http:/www.vllg.com/Schwartzco/Stag/mudTyper+Weights/). I would rather get [National](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203163322/http:/www.vllg.com/KLIM/National/mudTyper+Weights/) instead of Stag sans. On the type tester, it seems like they would work well together, but I would love your opinions.

Is Stag/National a go or a no?

Sharon

 [‹ Link into a word](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203163322/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46194 "Go to previous forum topic") [Subliminal Marlboro logo on F1 car ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203163322/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46193 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Sharon Van Lieu

comments.content: In my opinion it’s a no, because it seems to look too similar to Stag slab with the rounded curves. I would prefer Stag sans, the forms sounds perfect together and it seems to look a bit cooler, more rational. National is more emotional.
Thank you, Nora. I like Stag Sans also, I just wanted National. I think you are right.
